info.name: Assets
info.description:
Asset management service allows you to manage and upload assets that can then be used to create banners. This service supports the use and administration of html, video, audio, flash, font and xml assets while the files themselves are sent as base64 strings. The assets are stored at client level and can be reused for diffrent banners or for different campaigns.

Note that after an asset is uploaded the returned value refers to the operation but not the object itself. To get the asset object you need to call Operation Results method and supply the OperationResult UUID.

item.name: Asset Files
item.description: This service allows you to downloads asset files according to search criteria.

request.description:
To download asset file please click "Send and download" button.

AdvertiserId and AssetIds are required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/Files/00000?assetIds=11111
(00000 - AdvertiserId, 11111 - AssetIds, can be separated by comma)

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve AssetIds using "GET Asset by UUID" method.

item.name: Assets
item.description: This service gets a filtered list of assets or an individual asset based on its UUID.

request.description:
This method allows you to retrieve asset by uuid.

You need to parse asset uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/Assets/00000
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to get a list of objects where asset is ussed.

You need to parse asset uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/Assets/00000/Usage
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to get a unique asset title, if current is not unique.

You need to parse AdvertiserId and asset uuid in your request body.

item.name: Check if Asset Title is Unique

request.description:
This method allows you to check if asset title is not unique.

You need to parse AdvertiserId and asset uuid in your request body.

This method allows you to get assets using filter schema set in request body.

You need to parse AdvertiserId in your request body.

item.name: Audio Assets
item.description: This service manages audio (.mp3 .wav .ogg .flac .wma .gsm) assets and their attributes.

request.description:
This method allows you to retrieve asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/AudioAssets/000000
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to retrieve asset files using filter.

AdvertiserId is required in your request body.

Possible sorting directions: ASC and DESC

This method allows you to create Assets using Base64 encoding.

You need to specify  AdvertiserId and file format name in your request body.

This method allows you to change the title of your asset.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/Title
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to change your asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/File
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to change your asset batch.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/Batch
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to delete asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/AudioAssets/000000
(00000 - Asset uuid)

item.name: Flash Assets
item.description: This service manages flash (.swf) assets and their attributes.

request.description:
This method allows you to retrieve asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/FlashAssets/000000
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to retrieve asset files using filter.

AdvertiserId is required in your request body.

Possible sorting directions: ASC and DESC

This method allows you to create Assets using Base64 encoding.

You need to specify  AdvertiserId and file format name in your request body.

This method allows you to change the title of your asset.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/Title
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to change your asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/File
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to change your asset batch.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/Batch
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to update your asset ClickTags.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/ClickTags
(00000 - Asset uuid)

NOTE: You cannot update asset ClickTags, if asset is in use.

This method allows you to update your asset events.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/XmlAssets/00000/Events
(00000 - Asset uuid)

This method allows you to delete asset file.

Asset uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/FlashAssets/000000
(00000 - Asset uuid)

item.name: Operation Results
item.description: This service returns the object that was created and its information.

request.description:
This method returns results by CorrelationId which is generated in asset request responses.

Please note, that if operation results retrieves no content, it should be re-sent as this operation is asynchronious from other operations. Therefore, it may be in process of generating once it is requested.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Assets/OperationResults/00000
(00000 - CorrelationId)

item.name: Package
item.description: This service allows you to create new assets from package.

request.description:
This method allows you to create a new package by parsing asset details in request body.

You need to parse AdvertiserId, file format type (for example: .png, .jpg) and file data encoded in base64.
